db:abstract.db:para: Base type of popup-like user interface controls.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Popup is the base type of popup-like user interface controls. It can be used with Window or ApplicationWindow.
Popup does not provide a layout of its own, but requires you to position its contents, for instance by creating a RowLayout or a ColumnLayout.
Items declared as children of a Popup are automatically parented to the Popups's contentItem. Items created dynamically need to be explicitly parented to the contentItem.

db:section.db:title: Popup Layout
db:section.db:para: The following diagram illustrates the layout of a popup within a window:

The implicitWidth and implicitHeight of a popup are typically based on the implicit sizes of the background and the content item plus any insets and paddings. These properties determine how large the popup will be when no explicit width or height is specified.
The geometry of the contentItem is determined by the padding. The following example reserves 10px padding between the boundaries of the popup and its content:
The background item fills the entire width and height of the popup, unless insets or an explicit size have been given for it.
Negative insets can be used to make the background larger than the popup. The following example uses negative insets to place a shadow outside the popup's boundaries:

db:section.db:title: Popup type
db:section.db:para: Since Qt 6.8, some popups, such as Menu, offer three different implementations, depending on the platform. You can choose which one you prefer by setting popupType.

Whether a popup will be able to use the preferred type depends on the platform. Popup.Item is supported on all platforms, but Popup.Window and Popup.Native are normally only supported on desktop platforms. Additionally, if a popup is a Menu inside a native menubar, the menu will be native as well. And if the menu is a sub-menu inside another menu, the parent (or root) menu will decide the type.

db:section.db:title: Showing a popup as an item
db:section.db:para: By setting popupType to Popup.Item, the popup will not be shown as a separate window, but as an item inside the same scene as the parent. This item is parented to that scene's overlay, and styled to look like an actual window.
This option is especially useful on platforms that doesn't support multiple windows. This was also the only option before Qt 6.8.
In order to ensure that a popup is displayed above other items in the scene, it is recommended to use ApplicationWindow. ApplicationWindow also provides background dimming effects.

db:section.db:title: Showing a popup as a separate window
db:section.db:para: By setting popupType to Popup.Window, the popup will be shown inside a top-level window configured with the Qt::Popup flag. Using a window to show a popup has the advantage that the popup will float on top of the parent window, and can be placed outside of its geometry. The popup will otherwise look the same as when using Popup.Item, that is, it will use the same QML delegates and styling as when using Popup.Item.

db:note.db:para: If the platform doesn't support Popup.Window, Popup.Item will be used as fallback.

db:section.db:title: Showing a native popup
db:section.db:para: By setting popupType to Popup.Native, the popup will be shown using a platform native popup window. This window, and all its contents, will be rendered by the platform, and not by QML. This means that the QML delegates assigned to the popup will not be used for rendering. If you for example use this option on a Menu, it will be implemented using platform-specific menu APIs. This will normally make the popup look and feel more native than for example Popup.Window, but at the same time, suffer from platform limitations and differences related to appearance and behavior. Such limitations are documented in more detail in the subclasses that are affected, such as for a Menu).

db:note.db:para: If the platform doesn't support Popup.Native, Popup.Window will be used as fallback.

db:section.db:title: Popup Sizing
db:section.db:para: If only a single item is used within a Popup, it will resize to fit the implicit size of its contained item. This makes it particularly suitable for use together with layouts.
Sometimes there might be two items within the popup:
In this case, Popup cannot calculate a sensible implicit size. Since we're anchoring the PageIndicator over the SwipeView, we can simply set the content size to the view's implicit size:

db:note.db:para: When using popup items, the popup's content item gets parented to the overlay, and does not live within the popup's parent. Because of that, a scale applied to the tree in which the popup lives does not apply to the visual popup. To make the popup of e.g. a ComboBox follow the scale of the combobox, apply the same scale to the overlay as well:

db:section.db:title: Popup Positioning
db:section.db:para: Similar to items in Qt Quick, Popup's x and y coordinates are relative to its parent. This means that opening a popup that is a child of a Button, for example, will cause the popup to be positioned relative to the button.
The following example uses the attached Overlay.overlay property to position a popup in the center of the window, despite the position of the button that opens the popup:
Another way to center a popup in the window regardless of its parent item is to use anchors.centerIn:
To ensure that the popup is positioned within the bounds of the enclosing window, the margins property can be set to a non-negative value.

db:section.db:title: Showing Non-Child Items in Front of Popup
db:section.db:para: In cases where popup windows are not being used, Popup sets its contentItem's visual parent to be the window's overlay, in order to ensure that the popup appears in front of everything else in the scene. In some cases, it might be useful to put an item in front of a popup, such as a virtual keyboard. This can be done by setting the item's parent to the overlay, and giving the item a positive z value. The same result can also be achieved by waiting until the popup is opened, before re-parenting the item to the overlay.

db:section.db:title: Popup Transitions
db:section.db:para: Since Qt 5.15.3 the following properties are restored to their original values from before the enter transition after the exit transition is completed.
This allows the built-in styles to animate on these properties without losing any explicitly defined value.

db:section.db:title: Back/Escape Event Handling
db:section.db:para: By default, a Popup will close if:

db:listitem.db:para: The user presses the key sequence for QKeySequence::Cancel (typically the Escape key)

db:section.db:para: To prevent this from happening, either:

db:listitem.db:para: Set the popup's closePolicy to a value that does not include Popup.CloseOnEscape.
Handle Keys' escapePressed signal in a child item of the popup so that it gets the event before the Popup.

db:section.db:title: Property Propagation
db:section.db:para: Popup inherits fonts, palettes and attached properties through its parent window, not its object or visual parent:

In addition, popups do not propagate their properties to child popups. This behavior is modelled on Qt Widgets, where a Qt::Popup widget is a top-level window. Top-level windows do not propagate their properties to child windows.

Certain derived types like ComboBox are typically implemented in such a way that the popup is considered an integral part of the control, and as such, may inherit things like attached properties. For example, in the Material style ComboBox, the theme and other attached properties are explicitly inherited by the Popup from the ComboBox itself:
So, to ensure that a child popup has the same property values as its parent popup, explicitly set those properties:

db:section.db:title: Polish Behavior of Closed Popups
db:section.db:para: When a popup is closed, it has no associated window, and neither do its child items. This means that any child items will not be polished until the popup is shown. For this reason, you cannot, for example, rely on a ListView within a closed Popup to update its count property:
In the example above, the Button's text will not update when rows are added to or removed from someModel after component completion while the popup is closed.
Instead, a count property can be added to SomeModel that is updated whenever the rowsInserted, rowsRemoved, and modelReset signals are emitted. The Button can then bind this property to its text.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] activeFocus : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the popup has active focus.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12)] anchors.centerIn : Item
db:section.db:para: Anchors provide a way to position an item by specifying its relationship with other items.
A common use case is to center a popup within its parent. One way to do this is with the x and y properties. Anchors offer a more convenient approach:
It is also possible to center the popup in the window by using Overlay:
This makes it easy to center a popup in the window from any component.

db:note.db:para: Popups can only be centered within their immediate parent or the window overlay; trying to center in other items will produce a warning.

db:section.db:para: This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12).

db:member.db:link: Using Qt Quick Controls types in property declarations

db:section.db:title: [read-only] availableHeight : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the height available to the contentItem after deducting vertical padding from the height of the popup.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] availableWidth : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the width available to the contentItem after deducting horizontal padding from the width of the popup.

db:section.db:title: background : Item
db:section.db:para: This property holds the background item.

db:note.db:para: If the background item has no explicit size specified, it automatically follows the popup's size. In most cases, there is no need to specify width or height for a background item.

Most popups use the implicit size of the background item to calculate the implicit size of the popup itself. If you replace the background item with a custom one, you should also consider providing a sensible implicit size for it (unless it is an item like Image which has its own implicit size).

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12)] bottomInset : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the bottom inset for the background.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12).

db:section.db:title: bottomMargin : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the distance between the bottom edge of the popup and the bottom edge of its window.
A popup with a negative bottom margin is not pushed within the bottom edge of the enclosing window. The default value is -1.

db:section.db:title: bottomPadding : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the bottom padding. Unless explicitly set, the value is equal to verticalPadding.
The padding properties are used to control the geometry of the content item.
Popup uses the same approach to padding as Control. For a visual explanation of the padding system, see the Control Layout section of the documentation.

db:section.db:title: clip : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether clipping is enabled. The default value is false. Clipping only works when the popup isn't in its own window.

db:section.db:title: closePolicy : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property determines the circumstances under which the popup closes. The flags can be combined to allow several ways of closing the popup.
The available values are:

db:td.db:para: The popup will only close when manually instructed to do so.
The popup will close when the mouse is pressed outside of it.
The popup will close when the mouse is pressed outside of its parent.
The popup will close when the mouse is released outside of it.
The popup will close when the mouse is released outside of its parent.
The popup will close when the escape key is pressed while the popup has active focus.

db:section.db:para: The CloseOnPress* and CloseOnRelease* policies only apply for events outside of popups. That is, if there are two popups open and the first has Popup.CloseOnPressOutside as its policy, clicking on the second popup will not result in the first closing.
The default value is Popup.CloseOnEscape | Popup.CloseOnPressOutside.

db:note.db:para: There is a known limitation that the Popup.CloseOnReleaseOutside and Popup.CloseOnReleaseOutsideParent policies only work with modal popups.

db:section.db:title: contentChildren : list<Item>
db:section.db:para: This property holds the list of content children.
The list contains all items that have been declared in QML as children of the popup.

db:note.db:para: Unlike contentData, contentChildren does not include non-visual QML objects.

db:section.db:title: [default] contentData : list<QtObject>
db:section.db:para: This property holds the list of content data.
The list contains all objects that have been declared in QML as children of the popup.

db:note.db:para: Unlike contentChildren, contentData does include non-visual QML objects.

db:section.db:title: contentHeight : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the content height. It is used for calculating the total implicit height of the Popup.
For more information, see Popup Sizing.

db:section.db:title: contentItem : Item
db:section.db:para: This property holds the content item of the popup.
The content item is the visual implementation of the popup. When the popup is made visible, the content item is automatically reparented to the overlay item.

db:note.db:para: The content item is automatically resized to fit within the padding of the popup.

Most popups use the implicit size of the content item to calculate the implicit size of the popup itself. If you replace the content item with a custom one, you should also consider providing a sensible implicit size for it (unless it is an item like Text which has its own implicit size).

db:section.db:title: contentWidth : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the content width. It is used for calculating the total implicit width of the Popup.
For more information, see Popup Sizing.

db:section.db:title: dim : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the popup dims the background.
Unless explicitly set, this property follows the value of modal. To return to the default value, set this property to undefined.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] enabled : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the popup is enabled. The default value is true.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: enter : Transition
db:section.db:para: This property holds the transition that is applied to the popup item when the popup is opened and enters the screen.
The following example animates the opacity of the popup when it enters the screen:

db:section.db:title: exit : Transition
db:section.db:para: This property holds the transition that is applied to the popup item when the popup is closed and exits the screen.
The following example animates the opacity of the popup when it exits the screen:

db:section.db:title: focus : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the popup wants focus.
When the popup actually receives focus, activeFocus will be true. For more information, see Keyboard Focus in Qt Quick.
The default value is false.

db:section.db:title: font : font
db:section.db:para: This property holds the font currently set for the popup.

Popup propagates explicit font properties to its children. If you change a specific property on a popup's font, that property propagates to all of the popup's children, overriding any system defaults for that property.

db:section.db:title: height : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the height of the popup.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12)] horizontalPadding : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the horizontal padding. Unless explicitly set, the value is equal to padding.
The padding properties are used to control the geometry of the content item.
Popup uses the same approach to padding as Control. For a visual explanation of the padding system, see the Control Layout section of the documentation.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12).

db:section.db:title: [read-only, since QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12)] implicitBackgroundHeight : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the implicit background height.
The value is equal to background ? background.implicitHeight : 0.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12).

db:section.db:title: [read-only, since QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12)] implicitBackgroundWidth : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the implicit background width.
The value is equal to background ? background.implicitWidth : 0.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12).

db:section.db:title: [read-only, since QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12)] implicitContentHeight : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the implicit content height.
The value is calculated based on the content children.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12).

db:section.db:title: [read-only, since QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12)] implicitContentWidth : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the implicit content width.
The value is calculated based on the content children.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12).

db:section.db:title: implicitHeight : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the implicit height of the popup.

db:section.db:title: implicitWidth : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the implicit width of the popup.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12)] leftInset : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the left inset for the background.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12).

db:section.db:title: leftMargin : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the distance between the left edge of the popup and the left edge of its window.
A popup with a negative left margin is not pushed within the left edge of the enclosing window. The default value is -1.

db:section.db:title: leftPadding : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the left padding. Unless explicitly set, the value is equal to horizontalPadding.
The padding properties are used to control the geometry of the content item.
Popup uses the same approach to padding as Control. For a visual explanation of the padding system, see the Control Layout section of the documentation.

db:section.db:title: locale : Locale
db:section.db:para: This property holds the locale of the popup.

db:section.db:title: margins : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the distance between the edges of the popup and the edges of its window.
A popup with negative margins is not pushed within the bounds of the enclosing window. The default value is -1.

db:section.db:title: [read-only, since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] mirrored : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the popup is mirrored.
This property is provided for convenience. A popup is considered mirrored when its visual layout direction is right-to-left; that is, when using a right-to-left locale.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: modal : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the popup is modal.

Modal popups often have a distinctive background dimming effect defined in Overlay.modal, and do not allow press or release events through to items beneath them. For example, if the user accidentally clicks outside of a popup, any item beneath that popup at the location of the click will not receive the event.

On desktop platforms, it is common for modal popups to be closed only when the escape key is pressed. To achieve this behavior, set closePolicy to Popup.CloseOnEscape. By default, closePolicy is set to Popup.CloseOnEscape | Popup.CloseOnPressOutside, which means that clicking outside of a modal popup will close it.
The default value is false.

db:section.db:title: opacity : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the opacity of the popup. Opacity is specified as a number between 0.0 (fully transparent) and 1.0 (fully opaque). The default value is 1.0.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] opened : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the popup is fully open. The popup is considered opened when it's visible and neither the enter nor exit transitions are running.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: padding : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the default padding.
The padding properties are used to control the geometry of the content item.
Popup uses the same approach to padding as Control. For a visual explanation of the padding system, see the Control Layout section of the documentation.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] palette : palette
db:section.db:para: This property holds the palette currently set for the popup.

Popup propagates explicit palette properties to its children. If you change a specific property on a popup's palette, that property propagates to all of the popup's children, overriding any system defaults for that property.
See also: Item::palette, Window::palette, ColorGroup, Palette
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: parent : Item
db:section.db:para: This property holds the parent item.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.8] popupType : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property determines the type of popup that is preferred.
Available options:

db:td.db:para: The popup will be embedded into the same scene as the parent, without the use of a separate window.
The popup will be presented in a separate window. If the platform doesn't support multiple windows, Popup.Item will be used instead.
The popup will be native to the platform. If the platform doesn't support native popups, Popup.Window will be used instead.

db:section.db:para: Whether a popup will be able to use the preferred type depends on the platform. Popup.Item is supported on all platforms, but Popup.Window and Popup.Native are normally only supported on desktop platforms. Additionally, if a popup is a Menu inside a native menubar, the menu will be native as well. And if the menu is a sub-menu inside another menu, the parent (or root) menu will decide the type.

The default value is usually Popup.Item, with some exceptions, mentioned above. This might change in future versions of Qt, for certain styles and platforms that benefit from using other popup types. If you always want to use native menus for all styles on macOS, for example, you can do:

Also, if you choose to customize a popup (by for example changing any of the delegates), you should consider setting the popup type to be Popup.Window as well. This will ensure that your changes will be visible on all platforms and for all styles. Otherwise, when native menus are being used, the delegates will not be used for rendering.
This property was introduced in Qt 6.8.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12)] rightInset : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the right inset for the background.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12).

db:section.db:title: rightMargin : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the distance between the right edge of the popup and the right edge of its window.
A popup with a negative right margin is not pushed within the right edge of the enclosing window. The default value is -1.

db:section.db:title: rightPadding : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the right padding. Unless explicitly set, the value is equal to horizontalPadding.
The padding properties are used to control the geometry of the content item.
Popup uses the same approach to padding as Control. For a visual explanation of the padding system, see the Control Layout section of the documentation.

db:section.db:title: scale : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the scale factor of the popup. The default value is 1.0.
A scale of less than 1.0 causes the popup to be rendered at a smaller size, and a scale greater than 1.0 renders the popup at a larger size. Negative scales are not supported.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.1 (Qt 5.8)] spacing : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the spacing.

Spacing is useful for popups that have multiple or repetitive building blocks. For example, some styles use spacing to determine the distance between the header, content, and footer of Dialog. Spacing is not enforced by Popup, so each style may interpret it differently, and some may ignore it altogether.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.1 (Qt 5.8).

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12)] topInset : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the top inset for the background.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12).

db:section.db:title: topMargin : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the distance between the top edge of the popup and the top edge of its window.
A popup with a negative top margin is not pushed within the top edge of the enclosing window. The default value is -1.

db:section.db:title: topPadding : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the top padding. Unless explicitly set, the value is equal to verticalPadding.
The padding properties are used to control the geometry of the content item.
Popup uses the same approach to padding as Control. For a visual explanation of the padding system, see the Control Layout section of the documentation.

db:section.db:title: transformOrigin : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property holds the origin point for transformations in enter and exit transitions.
Nine transform origins are available, as shown in the image below. The default transform origin is Popup.Center.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12)] verticalPadding : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the vertical padding. Unless explicitly set, the value is equal to padding.
The padding properties are used to control the geometry of the content item.
Popup uses the same approach to padding as Control. For a visual explanation of the padding system, see the Control Layout section of the documentation.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.5 (Qt 5.12).

db:section.db:title: visible : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the popup is visible. The default value is false.

db:section.db:title: width : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the width of the popup.

db:section.db:title: x : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the x-coordinate of the popup.

db:section.db:title: y : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the y-coordinate of the popup.

db:section.db:title: z : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the z-value of the popup. Z-value determines the stacking order of popups.
If two visible popups have the same z-value, the last one that was opened will be on top.

If a popup has no explicitly set z-value when opened, and is a child of an already open popup, then it will be stacked on top of its parent. This ensures that children are never hidden under their parents.
If the popup has its own window, the z-value will determine the window stacking order instead.
The default z-value is 0.

db:section.db:title: void aboutToHide()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the popup is about to hide.

db:section.db:title: void aboutToShow()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the popup is about to show.

db:section.db:title: void closed()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the popup is closed.

db:section.db:title: void opened()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the popup is opened.

db:section.db:title: void close()
db:section.db:para: Closes the popup.

db:section.db:title: forceActiveFocus(enumeration reason = Qt.OtherFocusReason)
db:section.db:para: Forces active focus on the popup with the given reason.
This method sets focus on the popup and ensures that all ancestor FocusScope objects in the object hierarchy are also given focus.

db:section.db:title: void open()
db:section.db:para: Opens the popup.
